1.title: "O Couraçado 'Cachimbomanoff'" p. 9 in O Tico-Tico : Jornal das Crianças, no. 6
1.author: [No author]
notes: Summary (by M. Harbeck): In the Russian-Japanese War the lookout on a Russian cruiser thinks he sees the funnel of an enemy ship in the search lights so the cruiser starts firing. When nothing happens they cease fire and realize that it was an optical illusion caused by the lookout's pipe partially spotlighted by the search light.

2.title: "Courage"
2.author: Chris Claremont & Allen Milgrom
2.appears_in: 23 p. in Kitty Pryde and Wolverine, no. 5 (Mar. 1985).

3.title: "Courage!"
3.author: Bill Everett, script and art ; Stan Goldberg, colors ; Bill Everett, letters
3.appears_in: 3 p. in Marvel Super-Heroes, no. 18 (Jan. 1969) ; reprinted from Sub-Mariner Comics, no. 35 (Sept. 1954).
notes: Data from Lou Mougin, Tony R. Rose, Merlin Haas, et al. via Grand Comics Database.

4.heading: Courage.
4.title: "Ayyappan : the Lord of Shabarimala"
4.author: script, Shyamala Mahadevan ; illustrations, M
4.appears_in: Mohandas ; editor, Anant Pai. p. 1-31 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 673 (1975, 2010 printing).
notes: (Epics & Mythology)

Summary from back cover: "With Shiva and Vishnu as parents, a child's life is bound to be unusual. Ayyappan's courage is unlimited and his wisdom unmatched. Vicious tigresses fall under his spell just as avenging demons succumb to his divine strength. Only power-crazed human beings are foolish enough to try to destroy this extraordinary lad. But, as he ascends to his rightful place as the god of Shabarimala, the glow of Ayyappan's compassion makes even earthly riches lose their glitter."

18.heading: Courage.
18.title: "Exceptional Courage"
18.author: Sami Toivonen
18.appears_in: p. 148-149 in Gare du Nord : an Anthology of Comics from Finland, Norway, Sweden, Denmark, and Iceland

19.heading: Courage.
19.title: "Fighting Bob Evans" 5 p. in Real Fact Comics, no. 17
19.author: [No author]
notes: Begins: "Among the many heroes that the U.S. Navy has produced in its long history, Robert Evans has a special place. He was 'a sailor's sailor,' and for half a century his name was the symbol of fighting courage and inspiring leadership."

20.heading: Courage.
20.title: "Fix Bayonets!" 4 p. in Atom-Age Combat, no. 2
20.author: [No author]
notes: Begins: "The need men feel to prove their courage is as old as civilization!"

21.heading: Courage.
21.title: "Four-Legged Sheriff"
21.author: Bill Finger, script ; Alex Toth, pencils ; Sy Barry, inks
21.appears_in: 8 p. in The Adventures of Rex the Wonder Dog, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1952).
notes: Rex helps Hank Sears regain his courage and capture two bank robbers.
Data from Gene Reed via Grand Comics Database Project.

22.heading: Courage.
22.title: "Grasshopper Courage"
22.author: John Albano, script ; Tony Dezuñiga, art
22.appears_in: 16 p. in Weird Western Tales, no. 16 (Feb./Mar. 1973) ; reprinted in Jonah Hex and Other Western Tales, no. 2 (Nov./Dec. 1979) ; reprinted in Showcase Presents Jonah Hex, no. 1 (2005).
notes: Summary: Amy Gauwell hires Jonah to help the town sheriff capture the Scortch Donnigan gang. Unfortunately she doesn't know the sheriff is working with the gang.
Appearances of Clem, Josh, Mr. Gauwell, Luke Little (the sheriff), and Abner.
Data from Gene Reed, Jim Van Dore and Max Capp via Grand Comics Database.

23.heading: Courage.
23.title: "Guru Arjan : the Man Who Knew No Fear"
23.author: script, Rajinder Singh Rag ; illustrations, Dilip Kadam ; editor, Anant Pai
23.appears_in: p. 1-29 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 740 (1983, 2010 printing).
notes: (Visionaries)

Summary from back cover: "When Guru Ramdas chose his youngest son, Arjanmal, to succeed him as the fifth guru of the Sikhs, it created a lot of ill will in his eldest son, Prithichand. But the choice was not wrong. Guru Arjan was the very embodiment of love, humility and courage. His greatest contribution to Sikhism was the compilation of the Guru Granth Sahib and the construction of the Har Mandir Sahib in Amritsar. he was the first Sikh martyr and by his death inspired his followers to uphold the truth under any pressure."

24.heading: Courage.
24.title: "Gustav Adolf, the Snow King" 5 p. in Real Life Comics, no. 16
24.author: [No author]
notes: "The warrior monarch of Sweden who led his army into Germany to safeguard the freedom of all Scandinavia! Soldier scholar, Gustav Adolf knew both courage and mercy!"

25.heading: Courage.
25.title: "Hanuman : the Epitome of Devotion and Courage`"
25.author: script, Anant Pai ; artwork, Ram Waeerkar
25.appears_in: 32 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 502 (1971, 1999 printing).
notes: (Epics & Mythology)
"Hanuman, the son of Pavana and Anjana, was born a monkey and yet attained a prominent place among the Hindu Gods, by his sterling character."

Summary from back cover: "Hanuman stands for extraordinary physical strength, courage and humility. Above all, he is know for his devotion to Rama. So, it was little wonder that Rama entrusted Hanuman with the task of carrying his message to Sita in Lanka. Again, it was Hanuman who brought him the life-giving Sanjeevani to revive his beloved brother Lakshmana who had been grievously injured on the battlefield. Even tody, Hanuman is regarded as the epitome of unfaltering devotion and unparalleled strength."
Script credit, subtitle, series and summary from 2010 printing.

26.heading: Courage.
26.title: "Hero in Hell" 66 p. in Combat Picture Library, no. 336
26.author: [No author]
notes: Begins: "Courageously and generously he had offered his life. Dozens of times Lieutenant Cain had volunteered for dangerous missions, and each time the prestige derived from his past achievements gave encouragement to the men under his command."

27.heading: Courage.
27.title: Honey Mustard
27.author: created by Ho-Kyung Yeo ; translation, Jihae Hong.
notes: First published in Korea in 2003 by Haksan Publishing Co.
"Manga comedy/romance."

Summary (from SkyRiver): After getting drunk in the hopes of working up enough courage to ask out the boy of her dreams, Ara winds up kissing the wrong guy, which leads to a forced marriage by her parents.
Translation of: Honi mosut'adu.
Library transliteration of author's name: Yo, Ho-gyong.

28.heading: Courage.
28.title: "The Jackal and the Wardrum : Panchatantra Stories of Courage and Curiosity"
28.author: script, G
28.appears_in: L. Chandiramani ; illustrations, Jeffrey Fowler ; editor, Anant Pai. 32 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 540 (1973, 2010 printing).

contents.title: "The Turtle Who Fell Off a Stick" 2 p.
"A Merchant and a King's Servant" 5 p.
"The Merchant's Son and the Iron Balance" 4 p.
"The Jackal Who Fell into a Vat of Indigo Dye" 2 p.

notes: (Fables & Humour)

Summary from back cover: "A hungry jackal finds food when he overcomes fear. A curious monkey meddles with something that does not concern him and comes to a sticky end. Philosophy, psychology, politics and human relations become simple enough to be understood by a child in Pandit Vishnu Sharma's brilliant work, the Panchatantra. Written and compiled in around 200 B.C., every story is as relevant today as it was in ancient times."

29.heading: Courage.
29.title: "Jataka Tales : Stories of Courage"
29.author: script, Margie Sastry ; illustrations ; Chandrakant Rane
29.appears_in: 28 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 615 (1990, 1998 printing).
notes: (Fables & Humour)
Title of 2010 printing: "Stories of Courage : Jataka Tales of Valour and Victory."

"There is strength in numbers, says a wise pig. Being honest and selfless can change your destiny, says a young fawn. A friend is your most precious possession, advises a gentle crab, while loyalty is a noble swan's prized virtue. But it is courage that really helps these exceptional creatures gain freedom and respect."
Series and summary from 2010 printing.

30.heading: Courage.
30.title: "Just Knock on the Door and Ask Her Out"
30.author: by Frank Cho.
notes: Summary: Frank fails to get up the courage. Brandy is watching from her window.

31.heading: Courage.
31.title: "Kin Courageous" 7 p. in U.S. Fighting Air Force, no. 9
31.author: [No author]

32.heading: Courage.
32.title: "Malta, Stronghold of Courage : the Heroic History of the Most Bombed Spot in the World!" 7 p. in Real Life Comics, no. 8
32.author: [No author]
notes: "Come behind the scenes on the little island fortress in the Mediterranean, and meet the soldiers and civilians fighting the Axis invaders as they have fought other enemies on the most-bombed spot in the world."

33.heading: Courage.
33.title: "The Man Who Was Freedom" 3 p. text in Real Life Comics, no. 20
33.author: [No author]
notes: "Thaddeus Kosciusko, Polish patriot, fought bravely for democracy on both sides of the Atlantic and proved a symbol of courage and determination!"

34.heading: Courage.
34.title: "Monkey Stories : Jataka Tales of Wile and Wisdom"
34.author: script, Meena Talim ; illustrations, Jeffrey Fowler ; editor, Anant Pai
34.appears_in: 32 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 543 (1973, 2010 printing) ; also printed in Amar Chitra Katha Special Issue, no. 5 (1994).

contents.title: "The Stupid Crocodile and the Monkey" p. 11-16

notes: (Fables & Humour)

Summary from back cover: "Monkeys frolic through these pages, imparting lessons in leadership and common sense. Murderous crocodiles, powerful kings and fearsome ogres are easily outwitted by thse winsome creatures. All they seem to need is careful thought and a lot of courage. But be warned: do not let monkeys loose in your garden or you may well lose sight of their virtues!"

35.heading: Courage.
35.title: "The Pandavas in Hiding : Outwitting a Wily Enemy"
35.author: script, Subba Rao ; illustrations, Ram Waeerkar ; editor, Anant Pai
35.appears_in: p. 1-30 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 593 (1981, 2010 printing).
notes: (Epics & Mythology)
Begins: "Duryodhana, the Kaurava, annexed the kingdom of his cousins, the Pandavas, by defeating them in a game of dice. In great glee he watched his five cousins and their wife Draupadi leave."

Summary from back cover: "King Virat's honour was at stake and his son, Uttara, was anxious to show off his warrior skills. But faced by the enemy Kaurava hordes, Uttara's courage vanished. It was up to his hero, the famous Pandava, Arjuna, to ensure that the young prince succeeded in his mission. And yet, Arjuna had to keep his own identity hidden, or the Kauravas would gain the upper hand."

36.heading: Courage.
36.title: "The Prince and the Magician : the Strange Adventures of a Young Prince"
36.author: script, Luis M
36.appears_in: Fernandes ; illustrations, Ram Waeerkar ; editor, Anant Pai. p. 1-30 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 743 (1982, 2009 printing).
notes: (Fables & Humour)

Summary from back cover: "When seven brave warriors go missing, and a beautiful princess is transformed into a dog, the twelve-year-old prince, Balaraju, swears to punish the culprit. His weapons, single-minded courage and an unfailing charm, seem puny against the spells of a powerful magician. All the same, the wise young lad's mission is brilliantly successful and he also finds he can cast a few useful spells of his own. An adaptation of a popular folktale from Andhra Pradesh."

37.heading: Courage.
37.title: "Rana Pratap : He Fought for Freedom"
37.author: script, Yagya Sharma ; illustrations, Pratap Mulick ; editor, Anant Pai
37.appears_in: 32 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 563 (1971, 2010 printing).
notes: (Bravehearts)

Summary from back cover: "Disdaining even the comfort of a bed, the valiant Rana Pratap waged a single-minded, life-long war against the might Mughal conquerors. His Rajput pride instilled a deep respect in the enemy. They realised that huge armies and sophisticated weapons are but aids, and that there can be no substitute for raw courage on the battlefield."
An earlier printing (no. 24, 1970?) credits the art to Ram Waeerkar.

notes: (Classics Illustrated ; no. 98)

43.heading: Courage.
43.title: "She Would Clean House"
43.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Martha reads the Major's essay, and speaks of the patriotism of her folks, the one-shot Rathbuns of Kentucky; he wishes she could be smuggled into the Kremlin with a mop.
Key words: Russia, courage, tigresses, typewriters.

44.heading: Courage.
44.title: "Sucre, Soldier of Freedom" 5 p. in Real Life Comics, no. 20
44.author: [No author]
notes: "Antonio Jose de Sucre : convinced that the courage of patriots was a match for the guns of empire, he led his troops against Spanish despots for sixteen years to bring Peru to its freedom."
Cover title: "Sucre, President of Bolivia."

45.heading: Courage.
45.title: "Take Courage"
45.author: Leffingwell.
notes: Summary: A man begs two dollars and bets it on Courage in the fifth race at fifty to one.

46.heading: Courage.
46.title: "Test by Fire" 3 p. in Real Life Comics, no. 21
46.author: [No author]
notes: "The courage of American manhood is often tempered in crimson flame, and Midshipman Walter G. Sittman proved this effectively in Tripoli Harbor."
Sittman was awarded the Distinguished Service Medal in World War II.

47.heading: Courage.
47.title: "Tipu Sultan : the Tiger of Mysore"
47.author: script, Subba Rao ; illustrations, G
47.appears_in: R. Naik ; editor, Anant Pai. p. 1-31 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 741 (1979, 2010 printing).
notes: (Bravehearts)

Summary from back cover: "Tipu Sultan died as he had lived, a free man. A childhood spent watching and helping in his father's campaigns had made him a shrewd general. From his father he also inherited courage and a sense of honour and, most importantly, the determination to oust the British from Indian soil. But this noble 18th-century warrior had no weapon against treachery."

48.heading: Courage.
48.title: "Veer Hammir : the Noble Warrior"
48.author: script, Rajendra Sanjay ; illustrations, M
48.appears_in: N. Nangare ; editor, Anant Pai. p. 1-31 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 692 (1977, 2009 printing).
notes: (Bravehearts)

Summary from back cover: "Gifted with the intelligence of his mother and the courage of his father, Hammir promised to make an ideal king. But traitors grabbed his kingdom thus denying him his right to rule. Though it took him many years, Hammir tirelessly sought a peaceful way to regain his homeland, and eventually occupied the throne of his beloved Chittor without shedding a drop of blood. Kind but firm, he won the hearts of his grateful people as well as the admiration of his worst enemies."

49.heading: Courage.
49.title: Walt Disney Productions presents Hiawatha's Bear Hunt.
49.author: [No author]
notes: (Disney's Wonderful World of Reading)
Summary: When little Hiawatha hunts a bear to demonstrate his courage, his sister Sunflower comes to his rescue.
Funny kid fiction.

50.title: "You Had Every Advantage But Courage"

notes: Summary: Gene has lost a fight, and his friend confronts the bully who says it was a fair fight.

53.heading: Courage and Honour Win the Day.
53.title: "Vikramaditya : Courage and Honour Win the Day"
53.author: script, A
53.appears_in: P. Singh ; illustrations, H.S. Chavan ; editor, Anant Pai. 31 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 568 (1972, 2010 printing).
notes: (Bravehearts)
Begins: "About 1,600 years ago, a vast part of India was ruled by a great King, Samudragupta. Pataliputra was its capital. The king had two sons, Ramagupta and Chandragupta."

Summary from back cover: "Chandragupta Vikramaditya has a special place in history because he proved that the love of power is not all that is needed to create an empire. Also needed are the love of a wise woman and good, old-fashioned honour."
